bill.title: Relating To Consumer Credit Reporting Agencies.
bill.description: Expands the methods by which a consumer may request a security freeze. Specifies that a consumer credit reporting agency shall not charge a fee for placing, lifting, or removing a security freeze on a consumer's credit report or for placing or removing a security freeze on a protected consumer's credit report or records. (SD1)

history.action: Pending introduction.
Introduced and Pass First Reading.
Referred to CPC, FIN, referral sheet 9
Bill scheduled to be heard by CPC on Friday, 02-02-18 2:00PM in House conference room 329.

The committees on CPC recommend that the measure be PASSED, WITH AMENDMENTS. The votes were as follows: 7 Ayes: Representative(s) Takumi, Ichiyama, Ito, Johanson, LoPresti, Say, Tokioka; Ayes with reservations: none; 0 Noes: none; and 4 Excused: Representative(s) Aquino, Mizuno, Yamane, McDermott.
Reported from CPC (Stand. Com. Rep. No. 299-18) as amended in HD 1, recommending passage on Second Reading and referral to FIN.
Passed Second Reading as amended in HD 1 and referred to the committee(s) on FIN with none voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and Representative(s) Souki excused (1).
Bill scheduled to be heard by FIN on Wednesday, 02-21-18 2:00PM in House conference room 308.

The committees on FIN recommend that the measure be PASSED, UNAMENDED. The votes were as follows: 13 Ayes: Representative(s) Luke, Cullen, Cachola, DeCoite, Fukumoto, Gates, Holt, Kobayashi, Lowen, Nakamura, Todd, Yamashita, Ward; Ayes with reservations: none; Noes: none; and 2 Excused: Representative(s) Keohokalole, Tupola.
Reported from FIN (Stand. Com. Rep. No. 801-18), recommending passage on Third Reading.
Passed Third Reading with none voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and Representative(s) McKelvey, Quinlan, Yamane excused (3). Transmitted to Senate.
Received from House (Hse. Com. No. 94).
Passed First Reading.
Referred to CPH.
The committee(s) on CPH has scheduled a public hearing on 03-22-18 9:15AM in conference room 229.

The committee(s) on CPH recommend(s) that the measure be PASSED, WITH AMENDMENTS. The votes in CPH were as follows: 4 Aye(s): Senator(s) Baker, S. Chang, Ihara, Ruderman; Aye(s) with reservations: none ; 0 No(es): none; and 3 Excused: Senator(s) Tokuda, Espero, Nishihara.
Reported from CPH (Stand. Com. Rep. No. 3418) with recommendation of passage on Second Reading, as amended (SD 1) and placement on the calendar for Third Reading.
Report adopted; Passed Second Reading, as amended (SD 1).
48 Hrs. Notice 04-06-18.
Passed Third Reading, as amended (SD 1). Ayes, 22; Aye(s) with reservations: none . Noes, 0 (none). Excused, 3 (Senator(s) Harimoto, Inouye, K. Kahele). Transmitted to House.
Returned from Senate (Sen. Com. No. 568) in amended form (SD 1).

Senate Conferees Appointed: Baker Chair; Ihara, Ruderman.
Received notice of appointment of House conferees (Hse. Com. No. 609).

Bill scheduled for Conference Committee Meeting on Monday, 04-23-18 2:00PM in conference room 229.

The House Conference Managers recommend to agree to the Senate Amendments. The votes were as follows: 3 Ayes: Representative(s) Takumi, Cullen, Ichiyama; Ayes with reservations: none; 0 Noes: none; and 1 Excused: Representative(s) Tupola.
Reconsideration of action taken on 04-10-18.
Received notice of House reconsideration of action in disagreeing to the amendments proposed by the Senate (Hse. Com. No. 666).
House agrees to Senate amendment(s).
Passed Final Reading as amended in SD 1 with none voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and Representative(s) Holt, Quinlan excused (2).
Transmitted to Governor.
Received notice of House agreement and passage on Final Reading (Hse. Com. No. 675).
